intro: Gyrostachys bonariensis, commonly known as the Argentine ironwood, is a South American shrub belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, woody structure and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has elliptical, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is native to Argentina and is adapted to dry, rocky environments. Gyrostachys bonariensis is valued for its hardiness and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
